alert.note: Alert for White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 8:42AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central White, southern Warrick, Vanderburgh, Spencer, central Posey, Daviess, Henderson and northeastern Union Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 841 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tell City to Boonville to near New Harmony. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Boonville around 845 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Blairsville, Eureka, Rockport and Grandview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 165 between Mile Markers 65 and 70. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 139 and 148. Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 14. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
